thread.title: Gabriel Jesus has surgery in Barcelona to repair fractured metatarsal and faces eight weeks out
thread.title_full: Gabriel Jesus has surgery in Barcelona to repair fractured metatarsal and faces eight weeks out

author: gsweet
title: Gabriel Jesus has surgery in Barcelona to repair fractured metatarsal and faces eight weeks out
text:
JESUS UNDER KNIFE Gabriel Jesus has surgery in Barcelona to repair fractured metatarsal and faces eight weeks out 
Manchester City whizkid to remain in Spain for 48 hours - but he could rejoin squad in Abu Dhabi next week By GEOFF SWEET Comments GABRIEL JESUS has gone under the knife to have his broken metatarsal repaired. 
The young Manchester City striker had an operation in Barcelona and will spend 48 hours in hospital before flying back to England. Reuters Ouch! Gabriel Jesus is hurt at Bournemouth 
Dr Ramon Cugat,a trusted medical contact of City boss Pep Guardiola, performed the surgery. 
He has previously treated Vincent Kompany and Kevun De Bruyne this season. 
Keep up to date with ALL the MANCHESTER CITY news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Jesus could be allowed to join rest of squad in Abu Dhabi next week for some sun and rest but he will be out for at least eight weeks. Related Stories Ars out? Arsene Wenger finally admits he could leave Arsenal THIS season as he faces decision over future GENT OUT OF SHAPE Pochettino watches stuttering Spurs slump to another loss and moans: We’re in a bad way SHINDIG Florentin Pogba shows off his custom shinpads with brother Paul's face... but he's still wearing a Juventus shirt I'M IN THE MONEY Former Arsenal and Real Madrid star Lassana Diarra is heading to the Chinese Super League i'M JUR MAN Chelsea wonderkid Dominic Solanke is ready to join Liverpool in a stunning summer switch Sutt get tough Sutton United will give Arsenal flops more to wine about following Bayern Munich humiliation 
Jesus was hurt at Bournemouth on Monday and the news of his injury came as a bitter blow after the 19-year-old Brazilian made such a blistering start to his career at the Etihad. Reuters It looks bad…and it turned out to be a broken metatarsal PA:Press Association 3 Medics comfort the injured Brazilian kid 
Jesus has scored three goals in five appearances for City since his £26.8million move from Palmeiras was rubber-stamped in January and has received widespread praise for the way he has adapted to English football. 
His absence opens the door for Sergio Aguero to restablish his presence in the City front line.
